description: Hide the recommendation to update TPM Firmware when a vulnerable firmware is detected. Enabled:Users will not be shown a recommendation to update their TPM Firmware. Disabled:Users will see a recommendation to update their TPM Firmware if Windows Security detects the system contains a TPM with vulnerable firmware. Not configured:Same as Disabled. Supported values:0 - Disabled (default)1 - Enabled
name: DisableTpmFirmwareUpdateWarning

options.description: (Disable or Not configured) A warning will be displayed if the firmware of the security processor (TPM) should be updated for TPMs that have a vulnerability.
options.name: (Disable or Not configured) A warning will be displayed if the firmware of the security processor (TPM) should be updated for TPMs that have a vulnerability.
options.displayName: (Disable or Not configured) A warning will be displayed if the firmware of the security processor (TPM) should be updated for TPMs that have a vulnerability.

options.description: (Enabled) No warning will be displayed if the firmware of the security processor (TPM) should be updated.
options.name: (Enabled) No warning will be displayed if the firmware of the security processor (TPM) should be updated.
options.displayName: (Enabled) No warning will be displayed if the firmware of the security processor (TPM) should be updated.
